labels.analysis: The MCP Server described focuses on deploying Python scripts to Modal, allowing users to generate and share modal applications directly from Claude with simple commands. This suggests it is primarily a platform for running and sharing Python-based applications in a cloud environment.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality aligns with "Cloud Services" as it enables deploying applications to a cloud platform (Modal). The ability to run Python scripts also relates to "Development Tools" as it aids in application deployment and sharing.

server_info_crawled.name: Server Modal
server_info_crawled.author: @Flux159/mcp-server-modal
server_info_crawled.overview: Deploy Python scripts effortlessly to Modal. Generate and share your modal applications directly from Claude with just a few commands.
server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Flux159/mcp-server-modal/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
